text: Psalm 107
Thanksgiving to Yahweh for His of Deliverance
Give thanks to Yahweh, for \add he is\add* good,
for his loyal love \add is\add* forever.
Let the redeemed of Yahweh declare\f + \fr 107:2 \ft Hebrew “say” \f* \add it\add*,
\add those\add* whom he has redeemed from \add the\add* hand of \add the\add* enemy
and gathered from \add the\add* lands,

from east and from west, from north and from south.\f + \fr 107:3 \ft Hebrew “sea” (\fqa yam \ft ), which usually means “west” in a listing of directions. The word “south” is expected (Hebrew \fqa yamin \ft ). Either the MT was corrupted early (along with \xt Isa 49:12; \ft the LXX reads “sea” in both) or it looks to the bodies of waters to the south (see also the Targum) \f*
They wandered in the wilderness, in a desert.
They could find no way\f + \fr 107:4 \ft The MT reads “way” with the previous line. \f* to a city to inhabit.
Hungry and thirsty,
their soul grew faint within them.
Then they cried out to Yahweh in their trouble.
He delivered them from their distresses
and led them by a straight way
to get to a city to inhabit.
Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his loyal love,
and his wonderful deeds for \add the\add* children of humankind,
for he satisfies \add the\add* longing soul,\f + \fr 107:9 \ft Thirst is perhaps in view \f*
and \add the\add* hungry soul he fills with good.
\add Those who\add* sat in darkness and gloom,
prisoners of misery and iron—
because they rebelled against the words of God
and spurned the counsel of the Most High,
he therefore humbled their heart with trouble.
They stumbled and there was no helper.
Then they called to Yahweh for help in their trouble;
he saved them from their distresses.
He brought them out of darkness and gloom,
and tore off their bonds.
Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his loyal love
and his wonderful deeds for \add the\add* children of humankind,
for he shatters \add the\add* doors of bronze,
and cuts through \add the\add* bars of iron.
Fools, because of their rebellious way
and their iniquities, were afflicted.
Their soul abhorred all food,
and they approached \add the\add* gates of death.
Then they called to Yahweh for help in their trouble.
He saved them from their distresses.
He sent his word and healed them,
and he delivered \add them\add* from their pits.\f + \fr 107:20 \ft This word is only found elsewhere in \xt Lam 4:20 \ft with the sense of “traps” \f*
Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his loyal love,
and his wonderful deeds for \add the\add* children of humankind,
and let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving,
and tell of his works with rejoicing.
\add Those who\add* went down to the sea into ships,
doing business on \add the\add* ⸤high seas⸥,\f + \fr 107:23 \ft Literally “many waters” \f*
they saw the works of Yahweh,
and his wonderful deeds in \add the\add* deep.
For he spoke and raised up a stormy wind,
and it whipped up its waves.
They rose to the heavens; they plunged to \add the\add* depths.
Their soul melted in their calamity.
They reeled and staggered like a drunkard,
and ⸤they were at their wits’ end⸥.\f + \fr 107:27 \ft Literally “all their wisdom was swallowed up” \f*
Then they cried out to Yahweh in their trouble,
and he brought them out of their distresses.
He made \add the\add* storm be still
and their waves became calm.
Then they were glad because they grew silent,
so he guided them to their desired harbor.
Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his loyal love
and his wonderful deeds for \add the\add* children of humankind,
and let them exalt him in \add the\add* congregation of \add the\add* people,
and praise him in \add the\add* assembly of \add the\add* elders.
He turns rivers into a wilderness
and springs of water into thirsty ground,
a fruitful land into a salty place,
because of the evil of its inhabitants.
He turns a wilderness into a pool of water
and a dry land into springs of water.
And he settles \add the\add* hungry there,
so that they may establish a city to inhabit,
and sow fields and plant vineyards,
⸤that they may yield fruit at harvest⸥.\f + \fr 107:37 \ft Hebrew “and make a fruit of produce” \f*
And he blesses them and they multiply greatly,
and he does not let their cattle become few.
When they become few and they are bent down
from \add the\add* oppression of calamity and grief,
\add he\add* pours contempt on princes
and causes them to wander in a trackless waste.
But he protects\f + \fr 107:41 \ft The sense is that of making something inaccessibly high, like a fortress \f* \add the\add* needy from misery,
and he makes \add their\add* families like a flock.
\add The\add* upright see \add it\add* and are glad,
and all wickedness shuts its mouth.
Whoever \add is\add* wise, then let him observe these \add things\add*,
and let them consider Yahweh’s acts of loyal love.
